sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israel intensifies its bombardment in and around Gaza's second largest city, Khan Yunis, as hundreds have died since last week's truce ended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No country is on track to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions, the Climate Action Tracker says, as delegates at COP28 gather in Dubai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Chaos and significant disruptions on Poland's southeastern borders as the blockade on Ukrainian trucks crossing into the EU continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israel has intensified its ground and air bombardment of Khan Yunus in Gaza in its push for a definite military victory over Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Casualties and others fleeing the fighting poured into the Nasser Hospital in the southern city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israeli forces also targeted the Jabalia area of Gaza after warning civilians to flee further south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many of those had already been forced to move from their homes in the north, and NGOs say there is nowhere safe for people to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Palestinian health ministry says several hundred people have been killed since last week's truce ended positive militants are continuing to fight street by street as this video by islamic jihad purports to show the idf says scores of its soldiers have died in combat since the ground offensive began and hamas continues to fire rockets towards is, with the city of Ashkelon among the latest targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was Hamas' brutal raid into Israel that killed at least 1,200 people that triggered the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It continues to hold more than 100 hostages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Delegates at the COP28 summit in Dubai have been digesting a series of grim reports about

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: the state, the climate and efforts to stem global warming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Euronews correspondent Jeremy Wilkes brings us the latest from the UN conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The climate action tracker shows that no country around the world is actually on track to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions in order to meet the 1.5 degree target of the Paris Agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We also had the Global Carbon Project, which revealed that emissions in 2023 rose by 1.1% globally, over 8% rise in India.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And we had the World Meteorological Organization's Decadal Review, which evens out all of the changes you may see because of La Nina or El Nino.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And it's a pretty bleak outlook for our planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: I spoke to the report author.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We're seeing accelerating climate change across a wide range of areas of the climate system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We see continuing increases in global temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We see sea level rise happening at increasing rate. We see ice sheet loss happening at an increasing rate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We see the oceans getting warmer and more acidic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: So we're seeing changes across much of the climate system, and they're generally changes which are not going in a good direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In the face of such evidence, what we really need to do is to change the conversation, according to Bertrand Piccard, the founder of the Solar Impulse Foundation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We need to show the solutions more than the problems. We need to show that decarbonisation has to be made through a profitable modernisation of the countries, by having more efficiency, stopping to waste energy and resources and polluting, but also stopping to waste money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: and polluting, but also stopping to waste money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So there is a climate urgency, yes, but there is an economic imperative that can probably be much more motivating for the world of economy, industry and politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: With those thoughts and those reports in mind, the big question now is whether, at the end of this conference, we will get an agreement to phase out fossil fuels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Jeremy Wilkes at COP28 in Dubai for Euronews. The Doniana National Park in El Rocio, southern Spain, a labyrinth of lagoons, wetlands and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: lush plains vital to the survival of rare and endangered birds. Despite appearances, these marshes are drying out. El resto de las marismas, el 98% está absolutamente seca debido en parte a la falta de precipitación y el acuífero ha sido expoliado de tal manera que ya no descarga agua sobre los arroyos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: De acuerdo con las últimas figuras, solo la mitad de los perros que normalmente se detienen en invierno aquí han llegado debido a la fruta intensiva y el cambio climático.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: winter here have arrived due to intensive fruit farming and climate change. The reduction in rainfall and the over-exportation of the groundwater to cultivate berries through illegal wells like this one has pushed the national park to the brink of collapse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While it has boosted UNESCO World Heritage status for 43 years, the UN body says it will withdraw its recognition if the government doesn't take steps to protect the site. El nuevo plan prevé la sustitución de algunos de estos invernaderos por cultivos de secano o devolver los terrenos a su situación original.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Hay un trasvase desde la cuenca vecina del Tinto Diel y Pérez ha probado de 20 hectómetros. Sería, si se pudiera materializar completamente ese trasvase, reducir a la mitad las extracciones del acuífero.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: La única forma de adaptarnos es eliminar el uso ilegal del agua y recuperar esa dinámica de los ríos y arroyos que vertían antiguamente a Doñana. and recover that dynamic of the rivers and streams that used to flow to Doniana.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The future of Doniana hangs in the balance, and the World Heritage Committee will examine the government's conservation efforts at the UN's Climate Change Summit in Dubai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ongoing protests at the Poland-Ukraine border by transport companies and truck drivers,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: with farmers now joining in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The blockade against Ukrainian trucks has created lengthy queues, causing significant disruptions worsened by winter conditions. We are all allowed to go home. It is not normal for someone to come and stay in the cabin for three weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Volunteers are providing Ukrainian drivers with food.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Artom is Ukrainian and has lived in Poland for years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We came here with food. We have hot soup. i żył w Polsce przez lata. Przyjechaliśmy z jedzeniem, mamy gorącą zupkę.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Wszystko takie podstawowe rzeczy, które kierowcy potrzebują, które tu stoją po prostu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Jednym z głównych pytań z polskich firm transportu jest skrapanie permity dla kierowców z Ukrainy, aby uniknąć disruptów transportu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Jest postulat skierowany do strony ukraińskiej o wyłączenie unijnych kierowców z patologicznego systemu, który nazywamy tą e-kolejkę, regulujący wyjazd z Ukrainy, wjazd do Polski.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: W oczekiwaniu na ten wyjazd jest czasem dla nas stracony. My po prostu musimy tam spędzić ileś dni, na ten moment jest około 12-14 dni tego oczekiwania. W samochodach czekamy. The second important issue is with the European Commission and its restrictions on the number of trucks transiting Ukraine and the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They were changed to help Ukraine after the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Odstąpienie od niekorzystnej umowy Unia Europejska-Ukraina, umowy likwidującej system wzajemnych zezwoleń, które dotychczas regulowały stosunki Ukraina-Unia Europejska, jeżeli chodzi o sektor przewozowy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Cokrowita likwidacja systemu zezwoleń, co zrobiła Bruksela, destabilizuje zupełnie rynek.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I potrzebujemy powrotu do normalnej sytuacji, w której przedsiębiorcy z obu stron zarabiają, wiedzą na czym stoją. To już miesiąc protestów na granicach z Ukrainą. W ostatnich dniach Polacy też zostały włączeni w traktowanie w Słowacji. It has already been a month of protests at the borders with Ukraine, and in recent days, Poles have also been joined by truck drivers in Slovakia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Magdalena Hodownik for Euronews from Dorohusk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The European Union and the White House both say they're running out of money for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU is currently disputing a 50 billion euro allocation to the war-battered nation, endangering crucial promises to Kyiv made months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile President Vladimir Putin's press secretary said Russia's economy is adapting well. It is clear that it is becoming increasingly difficult for them to pour money into the Ukrainian bottomless barrel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: As for us, our economy has adapted to the conditions of a special military operation and provides the necessary regime for continuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the United States, the Biden administration has warned Congress about the need to approve tens of billions of dollars in military and economic assistance to Ukraine. The country's budget director says the U.S. will run out of funding to send weapons and assistance to Kyiv by the end of the year. And she said that without it, Ukraine's efforts to defend itself from the Russian invasion may grind to a halt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's not good news in the classroom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While Asia, with Singapore in the lead, stands out once again in the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development's latest PISA education survey published on Tuesday, there's been an unprecedented drop in performance across its 81 member countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The survey is carried out every three years by the Paris-based organization to assess the ability of 15-year-olds to meet real-life challenges. The current edition shows decreasing achievements in mathematics, reading comprehension and the sciences. This was the first large-scale study since COVID-19, but it found that shutdowns during the pandemic were not the only reason for the downturn. Other factors include the quality of teaching and the level of support pupils received at school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Europe, top of the class was Estonia, with the EU's two biggest countries, Germany and France, ranked below Switzerland, Ireland, Belgium and Britain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The survey also looked at the impact of technology on education.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It found that moderate use of digital devices in school is associated with higher performance. But this depends on whether it was being used to support rather than distract from learning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: France's National Assembly has unanimously approved a bill to ban single-use disposable electronic cigarettes, commonly known as puffs an attempt to protect young people drawn to their flavors and mitigates the environmental impacts politicians adopted the bill on Monday with government backing it will now move to the Senate where it is expected to be adopted and could be in effect by September next year health officials say 5% of French people are daily vapers one of the highest vaping countries in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Edinburgh Zoo has said goodbye to a pair of giant pandas who are returning home to China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Yangguang and Tiantian have been a popular attraction in the Scottish capital since their arrival in 2011. They were the only pandas in the UK but since their arrival in 2011.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They were the only pandas in the UK, but failed to produce any offspring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The pair are the latest animals to leave the West after exchange agreements expired and have not been renewed by China, possibly due to tensions with Western governments.
